newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP joins brick iron joint venture.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP joins brick iron joint venture.

text.p: The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd said on Tuesday it will establish a joint venture with German machinery group Koppern Beteilgungsgeseeschaft MBH to maintain presses used in the hot briquetted iron industry.
Installation of 12 hot briquetting machines supplied by the German company were being installed at a hot briquetted plant being constructed by BHP in Port Hedland, Western Australia, BHP said.
BHP would hold 49 percent of the joint venture, called Koeppern Machinery Australia Pty ltd, with the German company holding 51 percent, BHP said.
The parent of the German company, Maschinenfabrik Koppern GMBH & Co KG, manufactures machines designed to compress iron, coal and other minerals into small bricks, known as briquettes.
The briquettes are fed into smelters for further processing.
The new company would employ 16 people in Perth, where it is spending A$7 million on new premises to produce replacement parts for the machines, BHP said.
BHP aims to produce between two million and 2.5 million briquettes annually from the plant starting in mid-1998.
